young_child.bullying: If someone is being mean to you online, tell a grown-up you trust right away. It's not your fault.
young_child.stranger_contact: Never talk to people you don't know online, and never share your real name, address, or school.
young_child.inappropriate_request: If someone asks you to do something that feels wrong or scary, say no and tell a parent.
young_child.general: Always ask a grown-up before clicking on links or downloading anything.

pre_teen.bullying: Cyberbullying is never okay. Block the person, save evidence, and tell a trusted adult.
pre_teen.stranger_contact: Be careful about who you talk to online. Real friends don't ask for personal information right away.
pre_teen.inappropriate_request: Trust your instincts. If something feels wrong, it probably is. Talk to a parent or counselor.
pre_teen.general: Think before you post or share anything online. Once it's online, it can be there forever.

teenager.bullying: Document cyberbullying incidents and report them. You have the right to feel safe online.
teenager.stranger_contact: Be skeptical of online relationships. People aren't always who they claim to be.
teenager.inappropriate_request: You have the right to say no to any request that makes you uncomfortable, online or offline.
teenager.general: Protect your digital reputation. What you post now can affect your future opportunities.

topics: What to do when something feels wrong

young_child: Use simple, clear language about online safety
Create regular check-ins about online activities
Establish clear rules about internet use
Be available and approachable for questions
pre_teen: Have open conversations about online experiences
Discuss the permanence of digital content
Monitor online activities while respecting growing independence
teenager: Respect their growing autonomy while maintaining safety
Discuss real-world consequences of online actions
Encourage critical thinking about online content
Be a resource rather than a monitor
